dialogues.text: It’s a mistake, Cristina.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: They predicted a little storm out of town, out of Oviedo, but it’s nothing serious. Don’t you worry. Really. As you can see here... There, it’s just, it’s just a little bumpy, right? Cristina looks over her shoulder and the camera pans slig to reveal Vicky, who sits in the back of the plane. She l around nervously. JUAN ANTONIO (cont'd) (to Cristina) Would you like to fly it?

dialogues.text: Um, no thank you!

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: It’s easy. It’s even easier than a car. Try it.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: By early morning, they had reached their destination and proceeded to a hotel that Juan Antonio had selected for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio, Cristina and Vicky walk across a balcony wi Two BELLMEN.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Vicky made sure she and Cristina had their own room and Juan Antonio had his. If he was disappointed, he hid it well. Vicky and Cristina walk down a corridor toward their room Juan Antonio walks toward his room.

dialogues.text: A church is in the background.  24.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)

dialogues.text: Cristina, Juan Antonio and Vicky look up at a sculpture o Christ on the cross.

dialogues.text: ...to see the sculpture that was so meaningful to him.

dialogues.text: Are you very religious?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: No, no-no. No-no, I’m not. The trick is to enjoy life, accepting that it has no meaning whatsoever. Cristina looks at Juan Antonio with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: No meaning? Vicky shakes her head and chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: You don’t even think that authentic love gives life meaning.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Yes, but love is...so transient. Isn’t it? I was in love with the most incredible woman...and...and in the end... Juan Antonio shakes his head and chuckles lightly.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: (grunting sigh) .she put a knife into me.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: My God, that’s terrible!  25.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you did something to deserve it. Vicky looks back up at the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cristina, Vicky and Juan Antonio sit at a table and eat lunch.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio took his guests for lunch. They discussed art and romance. He was full of stories about Maria Elena, his ex-wife, whom he both criticized and idolized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio talks to Vicky as Cristina takes photographs the buildings.

dialogues.text: He proved to be a good host, and in the afternoon, he took them to see the local sights, where they enjoyed hearing about the city and took photos. Cristina gets Vicky and Juan Antonio to pose as she takes picture of them.

dialogues.text: Cristina eats a homemade cake as Juan Antonio picks up a of them.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Later, they bought candy and cakes at a charming sweet shop, which were homemade and delicious. Juan Antonio offers Vicky a cake from the box and hands h napkin.  26.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)

dialogues.text: Juan Antonio walks across the lobby with two glasses of w

dialogues.text: You are very welcome. All right. Juan Antonio sits down. JUAN ANTONIO (cont'd) Well, now that the day is almost over, is it reasonable of me to ask you...if you would both join me in my room?

dialogues.text: Oh, come on. I thought we’d settled that.  27.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: No. Look, I’m not free. I’m committed. You know what my theory is? And when I drink, I get brutally frank. I...I think that you’re still hurting from the failure of your marriage to Maria Elena, and you’re trying to lose yourself in empty sex.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Empty sex? Do you have such a low opinion of yourself?

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: She’s just saying that it has to have meaning for her, that’s all.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I mean, the city is romantic. The night is warm and balmy. We are alive. Isn’t that meaning enough?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Hey, look, I just came along to keep Cristina company. I’m engaged to be married. I have a handsome, lovely fiance who I make love with, and also holds a very real place in my heart, and to be perfectly frank, Juan Antonio, if I were the type of person that played around.... I don’t think it’s in the cards for us. Vicky slaps her hands together and picks up her jacket. VICKY (cont’d) So, I’m tired. I haven’t slept in twenty-four hours and that is exactly what I’m going to do.  28. Vicky stands up and walks away. Juan Antonio nods his head, then looks at Cristina.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: I’1l go to your room, but...you have to seduce me. INT. OVIEDO HOTEL/JUAN ANTONIO’S ROOM - NIGHT Juan Antonio, holding a glass of wine, opens the door to reveal Cristina, who stands in the hallway.

dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA

dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.text: Blow it. You mean ruin the moment

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO

dialogues.text: Hm. And-and, uh...you also admire Spanish guitar, I hear

dialogues.text: Yes, yes.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I love the guitar.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Would you like to go to hear some wonderful guitar tonight? Vicky drinks from her glass and looks at him nervously.  43.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Mm-hm.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well, it’s, it’s a little late and, you know, I’m, I’m a little wobbly from the wine.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: No-no-no-no-no. You said you could hold your alcohol. Besides, we leave tomorrow. Vicky nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Okay, sure.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Great. Juan Antonio toasts with Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUITAR PLAYER sits on a chair and PLAYS the guitar. Som PEOPLE sit on benches and the ground to listen to him. Ju Antonio and Vicky sit amidst the group. Vicky listens intently to the music. Vicky turns and looks emotionally Juan Antonio. She then looks back at the guitar player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio and Vicky walk across the park after the performance. They are alone as they cross the grass.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: That was, uh, that was unbelievable. Thank you, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I was looking at your face and you looked very moved. Vicky nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yes, yes.  44.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: A few times, I saw a look like that.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Right. On, on Maria Elena, I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Oh, well, yes, maybe on Maria Elena. I mean, if she saw or heard something that moved her, yes.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You’re still in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: No, I’m not, I’m not. Vicky and Juan Antonio stop and turn toward one another.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Mm, that confirms it. Juan Antonio shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: No, she will always be a part of me and...she’s an important person in my life, but for the two of us something was...not working.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well...what element?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: We never found out. Vicky nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Mm. Vicky looks away from Juan Antonio, then looks emotionall him. VICKY (cont’d) You, um...you said you were looking at my face. Juan Antonio smiles at her.  45. VICKY (cont’d) Why?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Why were you looking at mine?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Was I?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: You probably saw my tears. Vicky nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yes. You...yeah, um, mm, I’ma little out of control.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I was looking at your face...because I find it very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Of course I do. Of course I do, and you know I do. Juan Antonio leans toward Vicky and kisses her. They kiss passionately. They slide down out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky sits in the backseat looking down as Juan Antonio f the plane and Cristina sits in the passenger seat beside

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: On the trip home, Vicky, who had mentioned nothing to Cristina, was silent. Cristina, on the other hand, talked nervously.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: I must apologize to both of you for, for ruining the whole weekend! I’m completely mortified! I’m...humiliated. I, I don’t know whether it was the wine.  46. CRISTINA(cont'd) It could have been the shellfish because of, you know, I have this ulcer, and I, I just thank God you knew enough sights to keep Vicky occupied. You know, I had these horrible nightmares that you two would be like oil and water, hating every minute of being together. I-I just couldn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky enters the library and walks along the stacks.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Vicky buried herself in work at the library. She put foolish ideas out of her head and concentrated on her thesis. But she found her thoughts frequently returning to Oviedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cristina carries her digital camera around her neck and w down a sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cristina, searching for a means of self-expression, wandered the streets of Barcelona, experimented with her latest passion photography, and believed that she had made a fool of herself exactly at the moment of truth with Juan Antonio. Cristina walks down an alleyway. She stops and raises her digital camera to take a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky, sitting at a table, works on her laptop computer o the balcony outside their room.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And then, forty-eight hours later Cristina came to Vicky with an announcement .

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Vicky, he called!  47.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Hm? What? who? Vicky stands up and looks down to see Cristina standing o the terrace below the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio. He called me just now.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio called you?

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: Yeah, he wants to see me and take me to some vineyard, some wine tasting or something. I said, “Absolutely.”

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: A wine tasting. But what about your ulcer?

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, it’s fine. A little wine’s not gonna hurt me. I mean the point is that he wants to see me. Isn’t that great?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: I can’t believe it. I never thought he was gonna call.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Mm, that’s great. I’m happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cristina sits at a cooking island and writes in a noteboo

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That night, the two women had trouble falling asleep. Cristina sat in the kitchen drinking coffee and working on her poetry.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky lies awake in bed.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Vicky, too, was lost in memories of a night that now seemed more and more unreal. Vicky’s cell phone RINGS on the night stand. She turns on lamp, then picks up the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, standing on a dock beside a small channel of water holding a cup of coffee, talks into his cell phone. Boats moored along the dock.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Hey, babe. Did I wake you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky sits up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) No, no, no, no. I was just going to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) I’m sorry I called so late. I had to get out of the office. Get some air, get some coffee, and I had this great idea. Check this out. Dad has contacts in the American Embassy in Spain. Right? I thought I could come early, work from there on my computer, and the two of us could get married in Barcelona. You said it was a romantic spot.  INT. EXT. INT.

DOUG(cont 'd) You know, we’ll just do a quick city hall-type thing. Course we’1ll do it all over again in New York and -- you know -- and have a huge blowout for our families and friends, but I thought it’d be fun. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) What? To get married here?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Yeah, why not? It’d be great to tell our kids we married in Spain, and I’m tellin’ ya, Dad’s friends would make it real easy for us.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE/BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Vicky looks uncomfortable. EXT. INT.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Oh, I, mm, I don’t know what to say. I...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) You don’t sound bowled over.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) No, it’s, uh...it’s just a surprise.  50.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) So w-, eh, look, we’re gonna marry in the fall anyway, and we’re gonna do that, too. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Yeah, so what’s the point?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) The point is, it’s different, it’s exciting. I told the idea to Ken and Alice. I called them earlier and they said they wish they’d done it. I mean, you know, in London in their case, but they were, they were excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Well, I, I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) You sound, uh, you sound a bit reluctant. Doug drinks from his cup of coffee.  51.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Me? No. Why, why would I, why would I be? No. I...1I...I think it’s a fine idea. I think it’s great, it’s a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Yeah, yeah, no, I think, I think it’s gonna be good. Listen, I’m gonna call you tomorrow. I know that I woke you up. I’ll give you more details tomorrow. I-I love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky holds the cell phone with a conflicted expression.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (whispering into cell phone) Yeah. Vicky looks at the cell phone then turns it off. EXT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE - DAY Juan Antonio drives a red convertible down a street on th outskirts of town. Cristina sits in the passenger seat. J Antonio stops the car in front of a gate to his house. He opens the passenger door for Cristina, then gets out of t car.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Okay. Juan Antonio opens the gate and they walk into the house. INT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE/STUDIO - DAY Juan Antonio leads Cristina across his studio. Half-finis canvases lean against the walls.  52.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio took Cristina to a wine tasting. After, he took her back to his house, a lovely place he had purchased from another painter years ago, and which served as his home and his studio. He showed her his work, which delighted her.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, this is incredible. INT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE/LIVING ROOM - DAY Juan Antonio leads Cristina across the living room.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She loved the colors and the wild, emotional way he applied the paint to the canvases. From there, it was only one floor up to his bedroom. He told her of his marriage to Maria Elena, and their deep love, and their terrible fights. He told Cristina he had not wanted to make love with anyone else in the bedroom they shared...till now. This time, Cristina kept her food down. INT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE/BEDROOM - DAY Juan Antonio lies atop Cristina on the bed as they kiss passionately and make love. Cristina rolls on top of Juan Antonio as they continue to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio and Cristina walk around a large sculpture a they examine it.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio took Cristina out several more times. They went to see a new sculpture by a friend of his.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio stands behind Cristina as she takes a photograph.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He showed her some of his favorite parts of the city, where she took photographs. They smile and walk down the sidewalk. Cristina aims her digital camera at some PROSTITUTES who stand against a wa on the far side of the street. NARRATOR (V.0.) (cont'd) Juan Antonio was friendly with all the whores and thought they would make wonderful subjects. Juan Antonio and Cristina walk. Cristina stops to take a photograph. Juan Antonio wraps his arms around her. Juan Antonio laughs. The prostitutes pose and Cristina takes a picture of them. Juan Antonio holds Cristina’s hand as th walk. NARRATOR (V.0.) (cont'd) He encouraged Cristina’s work, although she was always too shy to allow him to see it. Juan Antonio playfully wraps his arms around her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cristina and Juan Antonio sit at the table with a group o FRIENDS.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: He took her to lunch with his friends who were poets and artists and musicians. Cristina held her own quite well.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: The art is, the art is always related to the context...  54.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, one day, going to study yet again the Park Guell, which Gaudi had designed and which figured quite prominently in her thesis, Vicky had a chance encounter. Vicky enters the park from a staircase. Juan Antonio, carrying a sketchbook, walks down another staircase. He w off the stairs and looks up at Vicky with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Uh, hello, my--

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: My goodness, what are you doing here? Vicky and Juan Antonio kiss on the cheeks. Vicky gestures at Juan Antonio’s sketchbook

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Uh, nothing, just doing some, some sketches. Vicky nods nervously at him.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Well, I, uh, I didn't mean to disturb you, so....

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Disturb me, no. How could you disturb me? I...we never had a chance to say a proper good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, y-you could have called me.  55.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I...yeah, I, I debated it. But I didn't think there was much point

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but y-you, you never phoned. Not to say anything. I mean "Thank you, it was fun." Vicky rubs her forehead nervously. VICKY (cont’d) I mean, y-you don't make love to someone and then never call them...unless you were greatly disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Quite the opposite. But...you have plans to marry and I thought it best to stop anything before it led to a bad situation for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm only saying that we made love, and, and you seemed to drop off the face of the earth. I mean, I realize these things don't mean much to you.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I mean, to pursue matters would have only caused you anxiety, and for me, a disappointment. Vicky shakes her head at him.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I had the ability to hurt you after one night?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Maria Elena used to say that...only unfulfilled love can be romantic.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Right. Okay. Well, the truth is, you're, you're much more suited to Cristina.  56.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I've grown very fond of Cristina. So, I'm very happy for you and your husband-to-be. Vicky nods haltingly at Juan Antonio.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: And I...for you and Cristina. Vicky smiles at him and inhales deeply.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Right. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Bye. They kiss on the cheeks again. Vicky and Juan Antonio walk away from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug, holding two bags, rides up an escalator.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And so the morning came when Vicky's husband-to-be arrived from New York. Doug walks off the escalator and meets Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You look beautiful. Vicky opens her arms to him. Doug puts down a bag and kis her. They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi stops in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Juan Antonio, like certain creative men, needed always to live with a woman, and had invited Cristina to move in with him, which she accepted. Doug and Vicky get out of the taxi and walk toward the ho  57.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Beautiful! Oh, my God. Doug turns and looks at the CABBIE. DOUG (cont’d) How much do I owe you? Judy walks out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Hello! Hi, hi.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hello, how are you? Mark walks down the steps with Judy.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I’m fine. MARK. You made good time.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I’m Judy. Judy shakes hands with Mark.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Judy, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Hello, Doug. Welcome. Judy and Doug kiss on the cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, I've heard so much about you.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Same here. Mark steps toward Doug and shakes hands with him.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Doug.  58.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Oh, Mark, Doug, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Good to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Good to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: The bags are a bit heavy.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh, the bags.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Just leave those. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Great. Vicky, Judy, Mark and Doug walk toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: You know, Tom Sutter's an old friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Oh, you know Tom Sutter?

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: We play golf!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Well, I got some stories. You know, Tom has never beaten me.  59.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Oh, well, he's not the greatest player in the world.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: He isn’t?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky and Doug stand amidst PEOPLE in front of the museum

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: ...No, I didn’t know that. All right. Vicky smiles at Doug.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug leans back against the headboard in the bed after ha sex. Vicky lies under the covers of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (sighs) My God. Doug shakes his head. DOUG (cont’d) You're a whole different person here.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah? What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You were so into it.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well, am I not usually?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, no, of course you are. Yeah, y-- I'm giving you a compliment. Maybe it’s the Barcelona air.  60.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Come here, hold me. Hold me. Vicky slides against Doug. He puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: How's Cristina doin'?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, she's, she's already moved in with some guy.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: That was quick. Don't tell me he's a bullfighter.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (chuckles) No.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Writer? Composer? Tortured pseudo- intellectual and self-destructive?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Mm, yeah, I know. Sometimes she gets on my nerves with her crackpot love affairs. Doug shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah, look, I love her because...she's your friend, but I've often warned you about her. She's an unhappy person. Doug picks up a glass of water off the night stand and dr from it. I find her contempt for normal values pretentious. It's a boring cliché.  61.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, men like her.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Well, she's pretty. And not exactly difficult to maneuver into the sack. Doug runs his hand along her arm. DOUG (cont’d) Now you, on the other hand...took a little effort to get to bed. Vicky chuckles softly. DOUG (cont’d) Hey. Doug gently lifts her chin to make her look at him. DOUG (cont’d) But it was worth the struggle. Vicky smiles and nods at him.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah. Doug and Vicky kiss. EXT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE - DAY Juan Antonio paints on a canvas in the backyard as Cristi talks into her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) So Juan Antonio wants to take me to this old amusement park that he said that I would love, and I thought that we could just get lunch, um, all of us, and then we could all see it together.  62.

dialogues.text: Doug sits on the steps with a newspaper as Vicky talks in her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) What, tomorrow for lunch? Doug looks up and gestures at her.

dialogues.text: We, we can't. We have plans.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no. I, eh, no, we can always go boating with Mark and Judy. I-I'd like to go with Cristina and Juan Antonio.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I, I really want to go boating.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Yeah, that would, that would be great. Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Okay.

dialogues.text: Vicky and Cristina and Doug and Juan Antonio sit at a tab at an outdoor cafe.

dialogues.text: The two couples met for lunch and during the course of conversation, an awkward moment occurred. Juan Antonio looks at Cristina, who sits diagonally acros the table from him. Under the table, Juan Antonio raises leg toward Christina. Instead, he brushes his leg against Vicky’s leg.  63. NARRATOR (V.0.) (cont'd) Juan Antonio, having warm thoughts about Cristina, tried to brush his foot against hers, under the table, and accidentally brushed Vicky's. Vicky looks up at Juan Antonio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky, Cristina and Doug pose for a picture as Juan Anton points a digital camera at them. A roller coaster is in t background.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The amusement park was everything Juan Antonio led them to believe. It was antique and charming, and overlooked all of Barcelona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VENDOR makes a swirl of cotton candy. Cristina and Juan Antonio stand in front of the booth. The vendor hands the cotton candy to Juan Antonio. Cristina laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky and Doug spin around as they ride a merry-go-round. Doug smiles as Vicky looks around distractedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cristina stands beside Doug as he turns the crank on a gumball machine. Juan Antonio and Vicky walk on a walkway overlooking the city.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I see why you love your fiancé. He's, he's very charming.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, he's lovely.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: And very well suited to you.  64. Vicky glances at Juan Antonio, then shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I don't think I like the way you say that.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: No, I, I, I only mean that you make a comfortable couple, in the best sense, Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Look, you don't understand. I can't do anything about it now. I'mn-, I'm not saying the thought hasn't crossed my mind, but I, eh-- Juan Antonio taps Vicky on the shoulder

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO

dialogues.text: I'm surprised to see you.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: As am I to see you. I didn't think you liked parties.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Gabriella insisted that I come and she's an old friend. You know, of course, that Cristina and I are no longer together, right?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yes. So now you're just with your ex-wife?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: No, Maria Elena is gone as well.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh. For now. Juan Antonio nods, then shakes his head.  126.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Eh, uh, it's funny. Um, Maria Elena and I...we are meant for each other and not meant for each other. It's...it's a contradiction. I mean, in order to understand it, you need a poet, like my father (chuckles softly) Because I don't.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: How about you? All goes well with your husband, I'm sure?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, yes, he's wonderful. He's terrific. I'm, I'm quite...delighted with the way things turned out.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Why don't I believe you?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Uh...don't become flirtatious. You know, I realize your, your bed is empty now and you always had a little yen for me, but...we're preparing to leave by the weekend, so I--

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Meet me for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I'm too scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky looks at a mirror and rubs cream under her eye. Dou stands in the bathroom talking into a cell phone. They ar both dressed in their underwear.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) No. What? I, you're, you're breaking up, Tom. That you're breaking up. Where are you?  127. Vicky looks down wistfully. DOUG (cont’d) (into cell phone) Okay. That's better. That's better. Yeah, just try to stand still. Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Vicky look at a bird in a cage hanging from one the stalls in the market.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: We have to get a bird for...

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Uh, no...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: ...Mark and Judy.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: ...we can't get ‘em a bird.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: It's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: God, they're beautiful. I always, I always wanted a bird. You know, we should actually, when we get home, I'd love to get, like, a bird for the new house.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah. I, and you know, I'm, I'm leaning towards Bedford Hills. Vicky chuckles. DOUG (cont’d) What do you think? Vicky’s cell phone RINGS.  128.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I, yeah. Oh, I-- Hold on. Vicky takes her cell phone out of her purse and looks at Doug looks back at the bird. Vicky answers the cell phone VICKY (cont’d) Hello? INT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE/STUDIO - DAY Juan Antonio stands in front of a canvas talking into his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Spend tomorrow afternoon with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug leans down toward the bird in the cage as Vicky walk and talks into the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (to bird) Hey, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Oh, no, it’s not possible.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (to bird) Hey, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) We're, we're preparing to leave by the weekend. INT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE/STUDIO - SAME

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Be on the corner of Calle Tiles, Tiles in Pedralbes, and I'll drive by, and I'll pick you up at noon.  129.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Uh, no, I, uh, you're wasting your time, I can't talk now. INT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE/STUDIO - SAME

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Look, look, I'm not the kind of man who would try to come between a husband and wife. I'm not. I'm not. But Judy Nash called me and she tells me that you are not happy, that you are actually more in love with me than the man you married.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) I can't talk. Vicky hangs up the phone and puts it into her purse. Vick walks back to Doug, who’s standing by the bird cage. He h up a souvenir made of straw.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: This is nice. A STREET VENDOR approaches Doug. DOUG (cont’d) Yeah, really nice, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: STREET VENDOR
dialogues.text: She is nice. Vicky embraces Doug.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Hey, what's that?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey, babe. What do you think? Doug looks at the price tag on the souvenir.  130. DOUG (cont’d) Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: On the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, it was, uh, it was my, uh, language teacher.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: He wants me to have a good-bye lunch with him tomorrow at, at noon. Doug puts the souvenir back on the rack.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Oh, that's perfect. I'm gonna play golf with Mark in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky walks nervously out of the bathroom. She turns and looks at her reflection on a dressing table mirror. Vicky tries on various outfits until she finally settles on a w shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky stands on the sidewalk. Juan Antonio arrives in his convertible. Juan Antonio opens the door for her. Vicky g into the car and Juan Antonio drives down the street EXT. JUAN ANTONIO’S HOUSE - DAY Juan Antonio and Vicky sit at a table with dishes of food front of them. Juan Antonio clasps Vicky’s arm as he talk her. Vicky and Juan Antonio walk toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Uh...if you'd like to. Uh....  131.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Sure. Vicky and Juan Antonio walk into the studio, where there a number of Juan Antonio’s paintings piled up against the walls.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Uh, well, this is...uh, no, yeah I've been working on these ones lately. And...uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, they're very overwhelming.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: This is....

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Yeah. I mean, it's, it's very hard to explain a painting, right? Juan Antonio picks up one of his paintings.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: No, you don't have to. It's, it's fascinating. It's fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: This one, actually, should be...the other way around, but....Uh...

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: No, I, I like it very much. Can, can I, uh...can I be frank about something?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Yeah. Vicky gestures at a painting, which is filled with violen swirls of black and white.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: This one-- it's, uh...it's, uh, there's something very frightening about...it.  132.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Uh...well, that one is Maria Elena's. Juan Antonio rubs up against Vicky’s back as she gestures the painting.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Right, well, that explains it. It's very chaotic and...er-erratic al-almost. But, uh.... Juan Antonio steps up behind Vicky and embraces her tight VICKY (cont’d) Oh, God, what am I doing here? I don't know what I expect to happen.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: It's been, it's been...a long time since we made love that night in Oviedo. Vicky turns toward Juan Antonio and nods.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Y-Yes, I--

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: And I've thought about it many, many times.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm sure you weren't thinking about it when you were making love to Cristina or, or Maria Elena. Juan Antonio caresses her hair.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Well, I, I never lied to you. I, I mean, I told you from the first moment I was attracted to both you and Cristina.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I-I, look, I'm.... Vicky steps away and clasps her hand to her face.  133. VICKY (cont’d) I, I can't just go to bed with you. I'm...I'm not good at this.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: But you weren't nervous that night.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I wasn't married.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: You were about to be.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're right. It's what I want. Vicky shakes her head an Juan Antonio. VICKY (cont’d) But I-- What, what am I supposed to do? M-Make love with you and then and then go on with my marriage like, like nothing happened? Or, or just terminate it?

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Judy Nash says you are heading an unhappy life.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I, eh, she's talking about herself. Juan Antonio shakes his head at Vicky, then runs his fing along her neck.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: But...maybe you will understand more about your own feelings once we've made love.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, or less. Uh, look, I, I, I'm not saying I'm not tempted... Vicky leans toward Juan Antonio.  134. VICKY (cont’d) ...but it would require such an upheaval, emotionally, and, and from a practical point of view, you, you're not exactly the kind of man to plan a, a... Vicky and Juan Antonio kiss passionately. VICKY (cont’d) ...future with. A GUNSHOT is heard. Juan Antonio and Vicky turn toward the noise and see Mari Elena holding a pistol. Maria Elena SHOOTS the pistol aga at Juan Antonio and Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: iMaria Elena, deja eso!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! Oh my God, no!

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: No, no! Juan Antonio steps in front of Vicky and waves his hand a Maria Elena. Maria Elena lowers the pistol and COCKS it. JUAN ANTONIO (cont'd) Maria Elena! Vicky fearfully whimpers. Juan Antonio dashes toward Maria Elena.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Don't

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: iMaria Elena, suelta eso! Juan Antonio grabs Maria Elena and struggles with her for pistol.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA ELENA
dialogues.text: (shrieking) ...la mierda! jQue no!  135.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: jSuelta eso, por favor! Maria Elena. Maria Elena. jSuelta! iMaria Elena, suelta eso! jMdtame! jDéjame, que te mato! jQue te mato! jDéjame, que te mato! The pistol FIRES and hits a vase. Vicky cowers and holds hands over her head. Juan Antonio takes the pistol away f Maria Elena.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO SUBTITLES
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) You're going to kill Maria Elena, suelta. Ddamela, yourself! ddmela, damela. Ya.Ya.Ya. jTe vas a matar!

dialogues.speaker: MARIA ELENA SUBTITLES
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I don't want to live! I don't iQue no quiero vivir asi! want to live, damn it! iQue no quiero! Vicky walks hesitantly forward.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA ELENA
dialogues.text: iQue no quiero!

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO SUBTITLE
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Let it go. Now, now, now. Ya, ya, ya.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA ELENA SUBTITLES
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Don't you understand that I ¢Cuadndo comprenderas que no don't want to live, that I quiero vivir? Que no se puede can't live like this. vivir asi.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Maria Elena--

dialogues.speaker: MARIA ELENA SUBTITLES
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) My head is going to explode. iQue me va a explotar la I can't take this anymore. I cabeza! jQue no lo aguanto, can't take it anymore. que no aguanto mas!  136. JUAN ANTONIO (cont'd) Maria Elena. Maria Elena. Maria Elena gestures at the pistol in Juan Antonio’s hand

dialogues.speaker: MARIA ELENA SUBTITLES
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Give me the gun. Give me the Dame la pistola. Damela. gun. Damn it! Que me des la pistola. Que me des la pistola. Maria Elena slams her fists down on a table and sobs uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO SUBTITLES
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Maria Elena? Listen to me Escuichame, mi amor. Mi amor, please, my love. My love, escuchame. listen to me. Juan Antonio reaches his hand toward Maria Elena. JUAN ANTONIO (cont’d) SUBTITLES (in Spanish) Come. Give me your hand. Ven, dame la mano. Ven, ya. Come. It's okay. Maria Elena reaches out and clasps his arm.

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO SUBTITLES
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) It's okay, my love. It's Ya, ya, mi amor, ya. okay. The pistol in Juan Antonio’s hand suddenly accidentally DISCHARGES. Maria Elena and Vicky shriek. Juan Antonio dr the pistol to the floor. JUAN ANTONIO (cont'd) ijDios! Vicky holds her hand: the bullet has hit her in the hand. JUAN ANTONIO (cont'd) Oh, my God, are, are you okay?  137.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, oh, my God, oh, my God, my hand!

dialogues.speaker: MARIA ELENA
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, I'm so sorry! Que me has quitado la pistola. Blood spreads across Vicky’s hand. Juan Antonio goes to Vicky’s side. Vicky gestures at Juan Antonio and Maria El

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, you're both crazy! You're both complete--

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Let me help you.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Both of you are completely insane!

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: How the hell am I gonna explain this to my husband?!

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I, I can't live like this!

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Let me see, let me see.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: This is not my life!

dialogues.speaker: JUAN ANTONIO
dialogues.text: Let me see it. Juan Antonio turns toward Maria Elena and gestures angril her. JUAN ANTONIO (cont'd) (to Maria Elena) Maria Elena, Maria Elena. Mira lo que has hecho. No puedes traer una pistola a casa. Mi amor, no puedes traer una pistola a casa.  138.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You're d-- I just can't do it!

dialogues.speaker: MARIA ELENA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. I had bad dreams- -

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I'm so.... Oh, my--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Vicky are seen through the windows walking acros the terrace.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: ...understand what your language teacher was doing with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: ...he, he collects these antique firearms and he was showing me his favorite one and it, it just went off. Doug slaps his hands together angrily.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! We should sue him! That is so damn irresponsible! Vicky and Doug stop on the terrace. Vicky turns toward hi

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: No, no, it's not, it's not that bad, honestly.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Once the bandages come off, it'll be, it'll be a scratch.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: What would happen if something happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What? What are you saying? Doug steps toward Vicky and clasps her face.  139.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey...I love you so much. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Doug never found out the real story. Doug embraces Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy and Mark and Vicky and Doug walk past some sailboats a dock.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Judy knew the secret and, of course, was relieved Vicky had not been hurt worse, or killed. With Vicky leaving to go back to New York, Judy's plans to rescue Vicky from her own fate were put on terminal hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cristina and Vicky sit at a table at a sidewalk restauran

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When Cristina returned from Antibes, Vicky told her the whole tale, and Cristina thought it was sad how much Vicky had wanted Juan Antonio and was unable to say or do anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: ...But I would have stepped aside.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: No, no, look...I, I knew you had feelings for Juan Antonio from the moment you saw him.  140.

dialogues.speaker: CRISTINA
dialogues.text: But if I knew what had happened, I never would have gone ahead with it.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well, look, it was...it was a...a passing thing. Now it's over. Cristina looks thoughtfully at Vicky. Vicky looks uncerta at Cristina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Vicky carry their bags to the escalator. Cristin walks with them. They get on the escalator and ride down it.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Vicky went home to have her grand wedding to Doug... Doug gets off the escalator and walks out of frame. Crist and Vicky walk off the escalator and across the main floo NARRATOR (V.0.) (cont'd) ...to the house they both finally settled on, and to lead the life she had envisioned for herself before the summer in Barcelona. Cristina continued searching, certain only of what she didn't want. FADE TO BLACK.
